Description: Three beads and a spacer made of different materials. A: One spacer-bead made of bone, broken into three joining fragments, no finished ends preserved, a length of six perforations remained. The shape is very thin and flat. B: Fragment of the base of a poppy-seed pendant, made of jasper, most parts broken off. C: Two disc-shaped beads in different size, made of turquoise faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D15.Y and S, Mound β and X
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
